results.title: Cancer in women
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and Cheryl Wright
results.brief_description: A self-help film designed to convince women of the need for regular physical check-ups to detect and counter early symptoms of cancer. The cost of neglect is high, and the film presents ample and convincing evidence: what is shown is strong medicine, and intentionally so— the malignant growths, the ugly scars, the excised tumours. The procedures followed in examination for cancer are shown.

results.title: Cancer immunology
results.brief_description: Are there truly present, on the cancer cell, antigens different from those in the normal cell, i.e.cancer- specific antigens? If present, how can they be demonstrated? Moreover, through what immunologic mechanisms, and by what factors released from the host, are cancer cells destroyed? This film attempts to answer some of these questions.

results.title: Cancer by the carton
results.creator_credit: Leston Post, International Temperance Association and Harry R Smith
results.brief_description: The relationship between cigarette-smoking and lung cancer. Leading US surgeons and health authorities emphasise the parallel between increased smoking in recent decades and higher incidence of lung cancer. Also stressed is the shorter life of cigarette-smokers. The film dramatizes the story of a (fictitious) editor, who is trying to persuade the Board of a US magazine to publish the facts on cancer. Includes scenes of an actual lung operation, and of the diseased lung after removal.

results.brief_description: An educational cartoon about cancer for children and adults, that dispels some of the myths about cancer and encourages better understanding and discussion.

results.title: Cancer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Discusses the nature of cancer cells, and how they are identified. Stresses the importance of early diagnosis and prompt treatment in the cure of many cases. Shows the method of self-examination of the breasts; emphasises the need for women to have regular cell tests for uterine cancer; and the value of regular chest X-rays. Shows the work done by the Anti-Cancer Council of Victoria, the Cytology Service at Prince Henry’s Hospital and the Peter MacCallum Clinic.

results.title: Canberra today and tomorrow
results.brief_description: The rapidly developing capital city of Australia. Its beautiful site and many parks and gardens; national traditions enshrined in the Australian War Memorial, the Royal Military College of Duntroon and in Parliament House. The diplomatic missions, Canberra University College, research institutions. The corporate life of the city and plans for its future.

results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Milson and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Gives impressions of Australia’s national capital and the life of its inhabitants. Shows government buildings and other architectural features, but emphasises the merits of the pace of life, climate and scenery.

results.title: Canaries to clydesdales
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Eugene Boyko
results.brief_description: A view of the practice of veterinary partners working in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. Thirty thousand miles of house calls a year is routine for these two country veterinarians whose patients include just about any creature that hops, trots, swims or flies. This film follows Doctors Vic Demetrick and Reg Maidment through the daily rounds that take them from sterile clinic to farm paddock. The devoted vets obviously relish their work. They display an enormous warmth and respect for each other, their animal patients, and their human clients. “Canaries to Clydesdales” shows that it takes compassion, commitment, and a strong dose of humour to succeed in this profession. After seeing this veterinary team at work, the career-minded will have the personal insight to evaluate their own qualifications. Awards: New York; Birmingham

results.title: Canadian wheat story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill MacDonald, Gudrun Parker and Beth Zinkan
results.brief_description: This is the story of what happens to the great wheat crops of western Canada after the harvest. The route is traced from the farm to the town elevator, by box car to the huge concrete storage cylinders at terminal points on the Great Lakes, down the Lakes to the homes and bakeries of eastern Canada, and to the ocean ports for shipment abroad.

results.title: Canadian profile
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Allan Wargon
results.brief_description: An informal portrait of the people of Canada at a time when modern technology is reaching into every phase of national life. Beginning with the fishermen of Newfoundland and ending with the Kitimat project on the west coast, the film explores the demands of a new machine age on people of diverse origins in whom the feeling for tradition is strong. In all there is evidence of change, adjustment, adaption as the industrial expansion becomes increasingly accelerated. Award: Toronto
